short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Effortlessly copy and organize the URLs of your open tabs in one click.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
CopyTab URLs is a powerful Chrome extension that allows you to effortlessly save and organize the links of all your open tabs in the current window. With just a click of a button, CopyTab URLs copies the URLs into the clipboard. 

The latest update introduces exciting features:
➤  Open multiple links with a single click!
➤  Opt for saving links with tab groups! This feature allows you to copy not just the links but also their respective group names. 
➤ Choose opening links with tab groups! You can open links within their specific groups, maintaining your organized workflow.  

With CopyTab URLs, you can copy and save your browser's tabs, complete with their order and groups, anywhere you prefer. And whenever you need to revisit the links, paste them into the extension to open them all. Its like instantly recreating your organized tab setup —no login or profile needed. Access all your tabs just the way you saved them anywhere, anytime.

Features (V1):
➤ Copy the URLs of all open tabs in the current window with a single click 
➤ Automatically copied to clipboard for easy sharing 
➤ View and edit the collected URLs in a user-friendly text box 
➤ Lightweight and intuitive, designed to enhance your browsing experience 

New Features (V2):
➤ Open multiple links simultaneously, bypassing the need to open each link individually.
➤ Copy links along with their group names, just select the checkbox "Include group names" 
➤ Open links within their specific groups, simply add group name (Format :#GroupName) before the list of links and select the checkbox "Include group names". 


Stay organized and save time by using CopyTab URLs to keep track of all the URLs you need. This is perfect for researchers, content creators, and anyone who wants to save and manage multiple URLs simultaneously. 

Download now and streamline your tab management workflow!

Note : The extension doesn't store any of your data.
